alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Halifax; Nash; Wake; Warren (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 10 at 1:28PM EST by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHERN WARREN...NASH...WEST CENTRAL HALIFAX...NORTHEASTERN WAKE AND FRANKLIN COUNTIES THROUGH 230 PM EST... At 126 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms near Zebulon, or 15 miles south of Louisburg, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Nashville, Louisburg, Zebulon, Dortches, Bunn, Wendell, Red Oak, Spring Hope, Whitakers, and Castalia. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Doppler radar has indicated weak rotation with one of these storms near Pilot. If the storm intensifies and rotation strengthens, a warning may need to be issued, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
